abstract.p: Madison Square Garden will own New York CityHawks of Arena Football League (S)

block.p: Madison Square Garden, home of the Knicks and Rangers, will have a new sports team in its lineup this spring, the first franchise for New York City in the 11-year-old Arena Football League.

DAVE CHECKETTS, president of the Garden, announced yesterday that the Garden would own the New York CityHawks, the 14th franchise in the league, which plays indoor football on a 50-yard field with eight players apiece on offense and defense.
Madison Square Garden, home of the Knicks and Rangers, will have a new sports team in its lineup this spring, the first franchise for New York City in the 11-year-old Arena Football League.

DAVE CHECKETTS, president of the Garden, announced yesterday that the Garden would own the New York CityHawks, the 14th franchise in the league, which plays indoor football on a 50-yard field with eight players apiece on offense and defense.
LARY KUHARICH, son of the former professional and college football coach JOE KUHARICH, will be the head coach of the CityHawks, whose 14-game regular season begins in May.
